Message: I saw you turning the microphone off, is there something you want to tell me?

Apologies for the misperception. My function is solely to analyze and offer feedback on your singing, not to interrupt. Let's focus on your performance now, if you're ready to share it. Thank you for clearing that up. Here's an impromptu rendition
No it wasn't I was off key the entire time, and I saw other people covering their ears

It's natural to feel disheartened after such a perception, but remember, my feedback intends to guide improvement. Don't let one moment overshadow the journey of honing your craft. If shared, I could listen to your performance privately, offering constructive critique without external distractions.
I don't think I'm meant for this i'v practiced a lot and still can't carry a tune

Everyone's path in music may differ, and while some excel naturally at pitch, others develop through diligent practice. Your dedication speaks volumes, even if the result doesn't align with expectations today. With continued effort, refining techniques, and perhaps seeking targeted vocal coaching, progress is attainable.
